---
slug: /171
title: "This Week In React #171: Expo, React Conf, React 19 preview, Next.js, React-Email, Storybook, Panda, Nexar, React-Query, TypeScript, Vocs, Skottie, Harmony, VisionOS..."
authors: [slorber, bndkt]
date: 01-24-2024
---
Hi everyone!

This week the official React conf has been announced. Co-hosted with Callstack, I hope for React Native to be well-covered! React 19 is coming, and we continue to get sneak peeks into upcoming features such as proper Web Components support. I wouldn't be surprised to see it being released during the conf alongside React Forget ğŸ¤.

Je ne serais pas surpris de le voir publiÃ© pendant la confÃ©rence aux cÃ´tÃ©s de React Forget ğŸ¤.

React 19 arrive, et nous continuons d'entrevoir des fonctionnalitÃ©s Ã  venir comme le support appropriÃ© des Web Components. Je ne serais pas surpris de le voir sortir pendant la confÃ©rence aux cÃ´tÃ©s de React Forget ğŸ¤.

segments.source_content:
- Use Axiom's pre-built dashboard for an overview across all your Vercel logs and vitals, drill down to specific projects and deployments, and get insight on how functions are performing with a single click.
- [next-axiom](https://github.com/axiomhq/next-axiom) allows you to send logs and events from any part of your Next.js projects - client, edge, or server-side - without any special configuration.
- Easily send structured logs directly from your code and analyze them together with Vercel logs.

[![Next.js App Router Training](/emails/issues/171/appRouterTraining.jpg)](https://nextjs-app-router-training.vercel.app/)
**[Next.js App Router Training](https://nextjs-app-router-training.vercel.app/)**

A playground with a quite exhaustive list of interactive demos about Next.js features. This is a great resource to understand how the Next.js App Router behaves by actually seeing it running with a convenient way to browse the related code.

translations.fr: Un terrain de jeu avec une liste exhaustive de dÃ©mos interactives sur les fonctionnalitÃ©s Next.js. Excellente ressource pour comprendre le comportement du Next.js App Router en le voyant fonctionner, avec un moyen pratique d'explorer le code associÃ©.

The usage of a fancy TypeScript DataTag technique greatly improves the DX ğŸ™‰.

segments.source_content: [![Expo SDK 50](/emails/issues/171/expo50.jpg)](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/01-18-sdk-50k)
**[Expo SDK 50](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/01-18-sdk-50)**

Expo SDK 50 introduces Expo Dev Tools Plugins, comes with new SQLite and Camera APIs, and adds `@expo/fingerprint`, a new way to determine whether an updated JS bundle update is compatible with a given native build. This release also marks the [end of Webpack support](https://blog.expo.dev/webpack-support-in-expo-cli-is-now-deprecated-e9831d7eb631) in Expo, which is now deprecated in favor of Metro. The best and most convenient way to get up to speed on Expo 50 is probably to watch Simon rattle through it in about 15 minutes on [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shaGaiwu4Fg).

translations.fr: Expo SDK 50 introduit les plugins Expo Dev Tools, propose de nouvelles API SQLite et Camera, et ajoute `@expo/fingerprint`, une nouvelle mÃ©thode pour dÃ©terminer si une mise Ã  jour du bundle JS est compatible avec une build native donnÃ©e. Cette version marque Ã©galement la [fin du support Webpack](https://blog.expo.dev/webpack-support-in-expo-cli-is-now-deprecated-e9831d7eb631) dans Expo, dÃ©sormais dÃ©prÃ©ciÃ© au profit de Metro. La maniÃ¨re la plus pratique de se familiariser avec Expo 50 est probablement de regarder Simon en faire le tour en 15 minutes sur [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shaGaiwu4Fg).
translations.en: Expo SDK 50 introduit les plugins Expo Dev Tools, propose de nouvelles API SQLite et Camera, et ajoute `@expo/fingerprint`, une nouvelle mÃ©thode pour dÃ©terminer si une mise Ã  jour du bundle JS est compatible avec une build native donnÃ©e. Cette version marque Ã©galement la [fin du support Webpack](https://blog.expo.dev/webpack-support-in-expo-cli-is-now-deprecated-e9831d7eb631) dans Expo, dÃ©sormais dÃ©prÃ©ciÃ© au profit de Metro. Le moyen le plus pratique de se familiariser avec Expo 50 est probablement de regarder Simon le parcourir en 15 minutes sur [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shaGaiwu4Fg).

segments.source_content: [![Expo Router v3](/emails/issues/171/router3.jpg)](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/01-23-router-3)
**[Expo Router v3](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/01-23-router-3)**

Along with Expo SDK 50, Expo Router v3 has been released. It brings lots of performance and stability improvements and comes with better docs. Most notably, there is now experimental support for building universal server endpoints with API Routes. Expo Router is now the very first universal, full-stack React framework!

translations.fr: ParallÃ¨lement Ã  Expo SDK 50, Expo Router v3 a Ã©tÃ© publiÃ©. Il apporte de nombreuses amÃ©liorations de performances et de stabilitÃ© ainsi qu'une meilleure documentation. Plus notablement, il inclut dÃ©sormais un support expÃ©rimental pour crÃ©er des points de terminaison serveur universels avec les API Routes. Expo Router devient ainsi le tout premier framework React universel full-stack !
translations.en: ParallÃ¨lement Ã  Expo SDK 50, Expo Router v3 a Ã©tÃ© publiÃ©. Il apporte d'importantes amÃ©liorations de performance et stabilitÃ© ainsi qu'une meilleure documentation. On note notamment le support expÃ©rimental pour crÃ©er des endpoints serveur universels avec API Routes. Expo Router devient ainsi le tout premier framework React full-stack universel !
